Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 15th overall pick, by Cincinnati in 1970...
Injured on 5/21/1970 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 6 days...
Injured on 5/22/1970 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Injured on 6/17/1970 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 4/24/1971 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 6 days...
Injured on 6/17/1971 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Injured on 8/18/1971 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 8/2/1973, off Chuck Hartenstein (SF)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/5/1973, off Bill Parsons (PHI)...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against St. Louis on 10/4/1975...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1976, hitting .429 with 3 HR, 6 RBI...
Traded from Cincinnati to Cleveland on 6/23/1978 (Going to CIN: P B. Apodaca, 2B L. Milbourne. Going to CLE: 3B B. Marcano, RF A. James)...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/1/1979 to a 3-year deal worth $2,225,252 per year...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
